text: Hi that seems to be working now, can you gaurentee it’s up time before I switch my code back?
Hi <@U05HG1700MN>, I’m on the HubSpot team that owns that action. Unfortunately changing the payload type is not supported in the webhook action at this time and is not on our roadmap.

Hello guys, we have been struggling for the past week in using the add contact endpoint ( <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/lists/add_contact_to_list|https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/lists/add_contact_to_list> ) For some reasons my email is added successfully including other company emails but all other email are not added and return invalidEmails

Any idea on what could be the issue?
Where in the API can you create/edit sales sequences?
If you are referring to Deal Pipelines, the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/pipelines|API doc is here.>
<@U058ZPH175H> I actually meant <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/sequences/create-and-edit-sequences|these>
Doesn't look like there is a Public API unfortunately :(

Hey everyone! I'm working on an integration with the HubSpot Webhooks API where I wanna know whenever a Contact unsubscribes from emails. The issue I'm facing is that when creating a new subscription in my Webhooks App I can't find any property that will allow me to receive this information in my endpoint. Tried both `contact.propertyChanged` and `contact.associationChanged` and none worked. Is this just not implemented yet? Any tips?

Priorities got shifted around, and this was no longer the top priority. So we didn't continue pursuing this with MailShake. Otherwise, that was the next step we would have taken in order to get to a resolution.
It doesn’t show up for some reason but you can type it in.
This endpoint assumes the contact is in HubSpot already, are you trying to add new contacts that aren’t already in HubSpot?
Yeah, trying to collect emails and add to a list from a custom frontend
You will have to create the contact first then add it to the list

Ohh :hushed: okay, thanks a bunch
I'm going to try that
Hmm, I can type it in but it doesn't show as a suggestion, only if I create a new property :thinkonk:
But it doesn't work anyway as it's not triggering the Webhook
I feel like I'm missing something else here. I've got my private app where I have all my companies, contacts etc... And for webhooks I had to create a public app
How do I make the connection between both? So that when something on one of my Contact changes, it triggers the desired Webhooks subscription?
Oh I need to "install" my public app, but I don't really wanna list it and make it public for everyone :thinkonk:
I don’t think listing is mandatory to install an app so long as you have the install url
That being said the install url will be able to be used by anyone if they have the url so
ok, makes sense
Ok thanks for the update! Let me know if that comes back into priority, curious to follow along
is there a recommended way to handle searching blog posts by a term AND by tags? It looks like I would need to use both the search API and the blog posts API
Man, the GET contacts list endpoint (all lists really) really needs to send all fields by default. I am stuck because my properties overflow the URI character limit. How are y'all handling this?
is there a common reason why `groupId=` might not work in the search API? shouldn't it be `contentGroupId?`  Are those values different? Where do I find `groupId`?
how many characters is your uri…? I just called a get on v3 companies api with 2896 characters and it was fine
17162 characters in the URI.
414 Request-URI Too Large error
The problem is my users have created many fields with long names.

wowza, do you need all the properties to accomplish what you need to do ? I rarely (actually never) retrieve all properties on any given object … just the properties that I need to achieve what I’m trying to accomplish

I never know what they need until they ask for it. So unfortunately, this will become an ongoing maintenance forever if I have to specify the properties. I am just super frustrated that it just doesn't send all fields by default or at least have a flag to send all fields.
:disappointed:

I would make use of `GET <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/properties/companies>` if properties change often then write a script to chop it up into reasonable sized uri’s I guess and merge the results into a single response…

At least that way you don’t have an ongoing maintenance.
(or whatever object) companies being an example
I thought about that. I'm already making 1500 calls to the contacts list (due to not being able to pull only items updated since X datetime). What a frustrating API.
And the 100 item limit is driving me nuts.
You should be able to use the search API for the datetime
The updated_at field doesn't work properly.
I have submitted a ticket.
the `hs_lastmodifieddate` ?
Yup, doesn't update when some fields change. Such as when an item is merged.
Also, the "archived" items do not transmit, so I can't ever remove the merged items from the historical data.
I don't know why there is even an archived flag if it doesn't send both true and false responses
defaults to false I guess
Do you see any responses with true? In any of the list endpoints?
?archived=true on list endpoint (like list companies) shows companies that have been archived i.e. companies that are in <https://app.HubSpot.com/recycling-bin/yourHubSpotaccountid/restore/0-2>
they will be deleted after 90 days of being archived
what's the timeout on "WARNING: The logs for this function have exceeded the 4KB limit."? I logged too many times I think

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/developer-reference/local-development-cli#:~:text=If%20you%20receive%20this%20error,lot%20of%20separate%20console%20logs>.

I don’t think there is a timeout? You just need to reduce the size of console logs
looks like `, or by a lot of separate console logs` is a thing too
it does work now after waiting
thanks for checking btw
Oh but you can't get both in the same response.
Good to know!

Multiple console.logs won’t effect the amount you’re going to be able to log in in a single run if I’m not mistaken.

However, if you’ve figured out some kind of workaround using multiple console.log() calls somehow, please share. That would be…wonderful.

Are you doing this within a coded action? If the portal has hubdb, you could have the users manage the relevant property list there. Pull and include in your request that way.

Or go the graphql route if that’s an option, should give you a bit more to work with.

Could even store them on a record with the sole purpose of holding those property references…depending on how desperate you are - ha.

All of that being said, I agree with the sentiment. Though, instead of including all properties within the response by default, I’d prefer a boolean parameter that defaults to false, but when set to true, will include all properties.
I'm pulling the data in Python to write to BigQuery.
Thanks, that worked

• <@U038DUUV3GE> Also this would be a problem with using search: The search endpoints are limited to 10,000 total results for any given query. Attempting to page beyond 10,000 will result in a 400 error.
